meanings.definition: To restore color to (something) by repigmenting.
meanings.sent1: She repigments her old paintings to make them vibrant again.
meanings.sent2: The artist repigments the faded mural on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The art restorer repigments the dull artwork, turning it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter repigments the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sun repigments the sky with hues of orange and pink during sunset.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the skin naturally repigments after sun exposure.
meanings.sent2: The leaves repigment as the tree enters the spring season.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon repigments its skin to blend in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph slowly repigments, revealing the colors of the past.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals repigment under the warm sunlight, regaining their bright shades.

meanings.sent1: The repigments of the hair were noticeable after using the new hair dye.
meanings.sent2: The repigments of the fabric brought back its original vibrancy.
meanings.sent3: The repigments of the artwork transformed it into a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The repigments of the landscape painting added depth and richness to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The repigments of the skin gave a natural glow to the face.
